article_node.title: Even at an All-Time High, The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF Isn't as Expensive as It Seems
article_node.summary: The S&P 500 has seen significant price increases, leading to higher valuations, primarily due to its growth-oriented composition and reduced diversification, making it more volatile. Despite its forward price-to-earnings ratio being above historical averages, some argue that the index's valuation could be justified as companies become more efficient over time. Investors can gain exposure to the S&P 500 through low-cost ETFs like the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, which is currently at an all-time high.
